title: Circle dances are found depicted on Achilles’ shield in the Iliad (18.504), performed by Phaeacian boys in the Odyssey (8.250), led by Theseus around the altar at Delos in The Hymn to Delos of Callimachus (300–316), and frequently associated with the Delian Maidens (Euripides’ Iphigenia in Taurus 427–430, Iphigenia at Aulis 1054–1057, and Herakles 687–690).
